findings.description: User input from query parameter 'id' is concatenated directly into SQL query without parameterization on a public endpoint.
findings.evidence:
const query = `SELECT id, account_number, owner_name, balance, account_type 
                   FROM accounts WHERE id = ${id}`;
findings.recommendation: Use parameterized queries: db.prepare('SELECT id, account_number, owner_name, balance, account_type FROM accounts WHERE id = ?').all(id)

findings.description: User input from query parameter 'q' is reflected directly in HTML response without encoding or sanitization, allowing injection of malicious scripts.
findings.evidence:
const html = ` Search Results

Search Results for: ${q}

Found ${results.length} results

    ${results.map(r => `
  • ${r.owner_name} - ${r.account_type}
    • `).join('')}
`;
findings.recommendation: Properly encode or sanitize user input before embedding in HTML. Use templating engines with automatic escaping or libraries like DOMPurify.

findings.description: Authenticated users can access any transfer by ID without verifying ownership, allowing unauthorized data access.
findings.recommendation: Add ownership check: verify that transfer.user_id === req.user.id before returning data. Return 403 if unauthorized.

findings.description: DELETE /api/users/:id endpoint is publicly accessible without authentication, allowing any unauthenticated user to delete any user account.
findings.recommendation: Protect this endpoint with authentication middleware (authenticateToken) and authorization checks to ensure only authorized users can delete accounts.

findings.description: API keys and database secrets are hardcoded directly in source code, risking exposure if code is leaked or accessed.
findings.recommendation: Move secrets to environment variables or secure vaults. Do not store secrets in source code repositories.

findings.description: Sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (PII) such as account numbers, SSN, and credit card numbers are logged in request headers, query parameters, request bodies, and responses.
findings.recommendation: Avoid logging sensitive data. Mask or redact PII before logging. Implement log filtering and secure log storage.
